description: {"blocks":[{"key":"2icmu","text":"In this protocol, we describe an end-to-end workflow for rapidly degrading a target protein using the AID system and quantifying newly synthesized mRNA using SLAM-seq in Saccharomyces cerevisiae. We describe methods for targeted protein degradation, 4-thiouracil (4tU) incorporation, rapid methanol fixation, RNA purification, RNA alkylation, 3´ mRNA-seq library construction, and data analysis. Although the individual methods described in this protocol are not novel per se, this workflow provides a complete resource for turnkey implementation of these methods, which will benefit others working with S. cerevisiae. In addition, this workflow is modular and readily adaptable to other systems, including industrial, pathogenic, or other model fungi, which will benefit the larger research community.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":170,"length":24},{"style":"italic","offset":604,"length":13}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ars2s","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"14tja","text":"REFERENCES","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"181q5","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"fclph","text":"Alalam H, Zepeda-Martínez JA, Sunnerhagen P. steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"5fkb1","text":"Add 5 ml of 100% methanol to a 50 ml conical tube for each sample to be collected. Keep tubes on dry ice. Three tubes are needed for each 40 ml culture.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"3vo9m","text":"When the 40 ml culture reaches an OD600 of 0.4-0.5, split the culture into three 10 ml aliquots in 50 ml conical tubes and return them to the incubator.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5evqr","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ftoob","text":"Each 10 ml culture represents one of three treatments:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"269rd","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"4lqt5","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"89oj5","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":1,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"akhmo","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"tables","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"cellsMeta":{"A_1":{"className":"_dt-bold"},"B_1":{"className":"_dt-bold"},"C_1":{"className":"_dt-bold"}},"colTitles":["","",""],"colWidths":["89","115","116"],"data":[["Treatment","IAA treatment","4tU treatment"],["A","DMSO","4tU"],["B","IAA","4tU"],["C","DMSO","DMSO"]],"guid":"8EE6D13C317E4F7AB56C3098916C16F6","isJexcelDataFormat":true,"legend":"","mergeCells":{},"printData":[["Treatment","IAA treatment","4tU treatment"],["A","DMSO","4tU"],["B","IAA","4tU"],["C","DMSO","DMSO"]],"rowHeights":[23,23,23,23]}},"1":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"cev0j","text":"DMSO is the carrier for both IAA and 4tU. steps.section: Saccharomyces cerevisiae growth, IAA treatment, 4tU labeling, and rapid fixation
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"fan8d","text":"Equilibrate cultures at 30°C for 5 min with shaking at 220 rpm.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Saccharomyces cerevisiae growth, IAA treatment, 4tU labeling, and rapid fixation
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"78pqu","text":"During equilibration (or just prior to splitting the culture), prepare a 0.2 M IAA solution in DMSO. IAA is freshly prepared. To prepare a 0.2 M IAA solution, add 220 mg of IAA to 6 ml of DMSO and vortex until dissolved. Keep the IAA solution at room temperature covered with foil.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"b4re","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Saccharomyces cerevisiae growth, IAA treatment, 4tU labeling, and rapid fixation
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"82vom","text":"CRITICAL STEP: Add 50 μl of 0.2 M IAA solution or DMSO to the appropriate 10 ml culture. Vigorously mix the culture and return it to the incubator. The final concentration of IAA is 1 mM.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":15}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Saccharomyces cerevisiae growth, IAA treatment, 4tU labeling, and rapid fixation
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"e405a","text":"Incubate cultures at 30°C for 25 min with shaking at 220 rpm.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"e8gqi","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"a4foo","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"ao2ai","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"f9nbv","text":"Cultures are generally incubated for 25 min for protein degradation prior to adding 4tU in Step 12. The total time for protein degradation is ~30 min. The time can be adjusted based on the experiment.","type":"unstyled"}],"collapsed":false,"entityMap":{}}}}}

steps.section: Saccharomyces cerevisiae growth, IAA treatment, 4tU labeling, and rapid fixation
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"6ilo","text":"During IAA treatment, prepare a 2 M 4tU solution in DMSO. 4tU is freshly prepared. To prepare a 2 M 4tU solution, add 260 mg of 4tU to 1 ml of DMSO and vortex until dissolved. Keep the 4tU solution at room temperature covered with foil.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8s6uu","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Saccharomyces cerevisiae growth, IAA treatment, 4tU labeling, and rapid fixation
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"ed168","text":"CRITICAL STEP: Immediately after IAA treatment, add 25 μl of 2 M 4tU solution or DMSO to the appropriate 10 ml culture. 4tU will precipitate when added to the culture; immediately and vigorously mix the culture and return it to the incubator. It is essential that cultures are uniformly mixed to ensure 4tU is dissolved and homogeneously distributed. The final concentration of 4tU is 5 mM.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":15},{"style":"bold","offset":243,"length":106}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2kk1a","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"bhqe3","text":"Incubate cultures at 30°C for 4 min with shaking at 220 rpm.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8t52","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3bvkh","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"90nkq","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"k5t","text":"Cultures are generally incubated for 4 min for 4tU incorporation. steps.section: Saccharomyces cerevisiae growth, IAA treatment, 4tU labeling, and rapid fixation
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"abv88","text":"CRITICAL STEP: Immediately after 4tU treatment, decant each 10 ml culture directly into 5 ml of 100% methanol in a 50 ml conical tube on dry ice (prepared in Step 5). Loosely cap the slurry and gently mix by swirling to ensure homogenization. Keep the fixed sample on dry ice. The final concentration of methanol is approximately 33%. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":14}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2m94h","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3skq7","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"4vn26","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[{"length":13,"offset":0,"style":"bold"}],"key":"bognt","text":"PAUSE POINT: Samples in methanol can be stored at -80°C. steps.section: Saccharomyces cerevisiae growth, IAA treatment, 4tU labeling, and rapid fixation
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"138uo","text":"Gently mix the fixed sample and transfer 250 μl to a 1.5 ml microcentrifuge tube. Store the 250 μl aliquot at 4°C for cell counting. Estimate cell number using OD600 or count cells using a Neubauer chamber.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"dckvi","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"atqbk","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"6lq0e","text":" ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":0,"length":1}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"33q1u","text":"The estimated cell number will be used to normalize samples for western blotting. It is generally sufficient to measure the OD600 for one treatment (e.g., Treatment A) for a given strain or replicate; the results for all treatments should be identical.","type":"unstyled"}],"collapsed":false,"entityMap":{}}}}}

steps.section: Saccharomyces cerevisiae growth, IAA treatment, 4tU labeling, and rapid fixation
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"4gv74","text":"Gently mix the fixed sample and transfer 1.5 ml to a 2.0 ml microcentrifuge tube for western blotting. Centrifuge the sample at max speed for 1 min to pellet cells, discard the supernatant, and freeze cell pellets at -20°C. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"et4mo","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"d8b37","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"am7vp","text":" ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"7o3t1","text":"Store cell pellets at -20°C (up to 2 weeks) or -80°C (long-term storage). The volume of culture collected is 1 ml. It is helpful to record the OD600 value (Step 16) on the 2.0 ml microcentrifuge tube for future reference. Although specific methods are not described in this protocol, the depletion of target proteins must be validated by western blotting in all experiments. ","type":"unstyled"}],"collapsed":false,"entityMap":{}}}}}

steps.section: Saccharomyces cerevisiae growth, IAA treatment, 4tU labeling, and rapid fixation
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"d27t1","text":"Centrifuge the remaining sample at 3,000 g and 4°C for 10 min to pellet cells.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"bq7t9","text":"Carefully decant the supernatant and briefly invert the 50 ml conical tube on a paper towel to remove residual supernatant.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"9510n","text":"CRITICAL STEP: Incubate samples at 94°C for exactly 4 min in a thermocycler with heated lid to fragment the RNA. Cool samples to 42°C in a thermocycler. {"blocks":[{"key":"aie4p","text":"Heat samples to 42°C for 60 min followed by 70°C for 10 min in a thermocycler with heated lid. Cool samples to 37°C in a thermocycler. {"blocks":[{"key":"h19s","text":"Add 1 μl of RNase H to each sample and mix well by pipetting. Centrifuge briefly at room temperature to collect samples.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"4f5oa","text":"Heat samples to 37°C for 15 min in a thermocycler with heated lid. Proceed directly to speedbead purification.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"hbd6","text":"Purify the single-stranded DNA (ssDNA). Add 39 μl of DNA buffer and 1 volume (50 μl) of speedbeads to each sample and proceed as described in the general method for speedbead purification (Step 76).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bv7ce","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"cvlqq","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"d0krl","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"f10ov","text":"Ensure speedbeads are equilibrated to room temperature and thoroughly mixed. DNA buffer and speedbeads can be mixed prior to use (here and in Step 74.5). If using commercial beads, it may be necessary to supplement beads with 0.05% Tween 20.","type":"unstyled"}],"collapsed":false,"entityMap":{}}}}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"ej75r","text":"Elute DNA in 21 μl of 10 mM Tris-HCl (pH 8.0) prewarmed to 50°C. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"eg39q","text":"Transfer 10 μl of purified DNA to a 0.2 ml PCR tube on ice.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"9jqum","text":"Add 2.5 μl of an appropriate 5 μM i5/i7 primer mix to each sample on ice.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"b91sr","text":"Add 12.5 μl of 2X Ex Premier master mix to each sample on ice. Mix thoroughly by pipetting.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"cm1j","text":"Barcode and enrich the library using PCR. Perform initial denaturation at 98°C for 45 s, followed by 12-18 cycles of amplification (98°C for 10 s, 60°C for 15 s, and 68°C for 15 s), and bring the reactions to 20°C.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"71etn","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"chkdu","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"daq98","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"2c74m","text":"Use 12-14 amplification cycles if starting with ≥500 ng of total RNA, 16 amplification cycles if starting with 200 ng of total RNA, or 18 amplification cycles if starting with 100 ng of total RNA.","type":"unstyled"}],"collapsed":false,"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"420cs","text":"Purify the library. Add 25 μl of DNA buffer and 0.8 volumes (40 μl) of speedbeads to the 0.2 ml PCR tube containing the amplified library.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bvrqg","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"46h8n","text":"PAUSE POINT: Store purified libraries at -20°C (up to four weeks) or -80°C until proceeding.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":13}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"ei7d5","text":"Thaw RNA samples on ice. Quantify RNA using a Nanodrop.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2t4nv","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"99a7e","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"5hm1n","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"4amdr","text":"RNA alkylation (iodoacetamide treatment) method is based on Herzog et al., 2017 (see also Alalam et al., 2022 and Chappleboim et al., 2022). Alternatively, the SLAMseq Kinetics kit – Anabolic Kinetics module (Lexogen) can be used for alkylation following the manufacturer’s recommendations. Iodoacetamide is referred to as IAA in Herzog et al., 2017; IAA refers to 3-indoleacetic acid in this protocol. Samples should be protected from light during Steps 56-62 when possible (e.g., work under red light or low light and keep samples covered with foil).","type":"unstyled"}],"collapsed":false,"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"8iiqi","text":"Add 5 μg of total RNA to a 1.5 ml microcentrifuge tube on ice. Adjust the volume of each sample to 20 μl with nuclease-free water.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"2mdmm","text":"Prepare a 100 mM iodoacetamide solution in DMSO. Iodoacetamide is freshly prepared. To prepare a 100 mM iodoacetamide solution, add 9.25 mg of iodoacetamide to 500 μl of DMSO (1 mg of iodoacetamide to 54 μl of DMSO). Keep the iodoacetamide solution at room temperature covered with foil. Do not store unused iodoacetamide.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"p0cv","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"mgch","text":"Resuspend RNA in 30 μl of nuclease-free water.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"9ncdr","text":"Add 30 μl of reaction mixture to the 1.5 ml microcentrifuge tube containing 5 μg of total RNA in 20 μl nuclease-free water (prepared in Step 57). The final concentration of iodoacetamide is 10 mM.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"ad7m9","text":"Gently mix the reaction and incubate in a thermomixer at 900 rpm and 50°C for 15 min in the dark.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"6d9hp","text":"Add 1 μl of 1 M DTT to stop the reaction. Briefly vortex to mix. Exposure to light is acceptable following the addition of DTT.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"5pg81","text":"Add 1 μl of glycogen (20 mg/ml) and 5 μl of 3 M sodium acetate (pH 5.2) to each sample. Briefly vortex to mix.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"fi8c3","text":"Add 125 μl of 100% ethanol to each sample. Briefly vortex to mix and incubate at -80°C for 30 min.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"dsea9","text":"Centrifuge samples for 30 min at 21,000 g and 4°C to pellet precipitated RNA.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"e9pnq","text":"PAUSE POINT: Store alkylated RNA at -20°C (up to four weeks) or -80°C until proceeding.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":13}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"1ueok","text":"Carefully decant the supernatant. Take care not to dislodge pellets. Carefully inspect samples and remove remaining ethanol with a 20 μl pipet.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"f94jj","text":"Air dry samples for 5 min with lid open. Do not over dry samples.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"905mg","text":"Add 1 ml of 80% ethanol to each sample. Centrifuge samples for 10 min at 21,000 g and 4°C to wash pellet.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"ahtnv","text":"Carefully decant the supernatant. Take care not to dislodge pellet.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"9kf9f","text":"Supplement the following buffers and reagents with DTT (100 mM DTT working stock):","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"d0ifn","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"auu7v","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":1,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"c5u82","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"tables","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"cellsMeta":{"A_1":{"className":"_dt-bold"},"A_2":{"className":" purification and DNase I treatment is performed using a Quick-RNA Fungal/Bacterial Miniprep kit (see Materials). Methods are based on manufacturer’s recommendations modified to maintain reducing conditions using DTT essentially as described by Alalam et al., 2022. Prewarm the required volume of nuclease-free water (supplemented with DTT) (see Step 54). Perform all centrifugation steps at 16,000 g and room temperature for 30 s (unless specified). Samples should be protected from light during Steps 36-55 when possible (e.g., work under red light or low light and keep samples covered with foil).","type":"unstyled"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"2ntca","text":"","type":"unstyled"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"dqiea","text":"","type":"unstyled"}],"collapsed":false,"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"6f3i8","text":"Thaw samples stored in DNA/RNA Shield at -80°C at room temperature. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"71t4a","text":"OPTION A (without spike-in): Combine 400 μl of RNA Lysis Buffer and 400 μl of cells suspended in DNA/RNA Shield.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":28}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"fjk7","text":"Process samples in a Mini-Beadbeater-24 at 3800 rpm for 45 s and immediately incubate on ice for 2 min.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"da7s1","text":"Repeat Step 40 once.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"bqree","text":"Centrifuge samples at 16,000 g for 1 min to pellet debris.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"1fr8","text":"CRITICAL STEP: Transfer 550 μl of the cleared supernatant to a Zymo-spin IIICG Column in a collection tube and centrifuge at 16,000 g for 30 s. Save the flow through.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":15}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"dlr66","text":"Add an equal volume (550 μl) of 100% ethanol to the flow through. Thoroughly mix samples by pipetting.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"estl","text":"Transfer 700 μl of the mixture to a Zymo-spin IICR Column in a collection tube and centrifuge at 16,000 g for 30 s. Discard flow through.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"1qsgc","text":"Repeat Step 46 with the remaining mixture volume. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"61sir","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"bc28f","text":"Add 400 μl of RNA Wash Buffer to the column and centrifuge at 16,000 g for 30 s. Discard flow through.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"b4qu6","text":"Gently mix DNase I reaction mixture (prepared in Step 42) by inversion and add 80 μl directly to the column matrix. Incubate the reaction at room temperature for 15 min.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"dbq3t","text":"Add 400 μl of RNA Prep Buffer to the column and centrifuge at 16,000 g for 30 s. Discard flow through.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"a5bq3","text":"Add 700 μl of RNA Wash Buffer to the column and centrifuge at 16,000 g for 30 s. Discard flow through.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"rt2p","text":"Add 400 μl of RNA Wash Buffer to the column and centrifuge at 16,000 g for 1 min to ensure complete removal of buffer. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"d22u9","text":"Carefully transfer the column to a labeled nuclease-free 1.5 ml microcentrifuge tube.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"c1fqu","text":"Add 50 μl of nuclease-free water prewarmed to 50°C directly to the column matrix, incubate at room temperature for 2 min, and centrifuge at 16,000 g for 30 s.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"d4q3o","text":"PAUSE POINT: Store purified RNA at -20°C (up to four weeks) or -80°C until proceeding.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":13}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"41cf0","text":"While samples are incubating on ice, prepare the following reaction mixture in a 1.5 ml microcentrifuge tube on ice:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"61e9n","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"a17m7","text":"DNase I reaction mixture","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":24}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"64k42","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"kcuf","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7d5e8","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":1,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"37fio","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"tables","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"cellsMeta":{"A_1":{"className":"_dt-bold"},"B_1":{"className":"_dt-bold"},"C_1":{"className":"_dt-bold"}},"colTitles":["","",""],"colWidths":["211","146","144"],"data":[["Reagent","1X reaction vol. steps.section: Saccharomyces cerevisiae growth, IAA treatment, 4tU labeling, and rapid fixation
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"2702r","text":"PAUSE POINT: Flash freeze samples on dry ice or in liquid nitrogen and store at -80°C until proceeding.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":13}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"cg31v","text":"Transfer 20 μl of the cleared supernatant to a fresh PCR tube.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"ufi2","text":"PAUSE POINT: Store purified DNA at -20°C (up to eight weeks) or -80°C until proceeding.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":13}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"96hgp","text":"Add 0.8 volumes (24 μl) of DNA binding buffer to the 0.2 ml PCR tube containing the library and bead suspension. Proceed as described in the general method for speedbead purification (Step 76).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":91,"length":1}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"77dc6","text":"Elute the library in 21 μl of 10 mM Tris-HCl (pH 8.0) prewarmed to 50°C. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"aigu8","text":"Transfer 20 μl of the cleared supernatant to a fresh PCR tube.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"7ov1u","text":"Mix well by pipetting up and down a minimum of 10 times. Alternatively, vortex samples on setting 4 for 3-5 seconds. If samples require centrifugation after mixing, stop the centrifuge before beads settle.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"cqdsr","text":"Place samples on magnetic stand for 2-5 min (or until solution is completely clear) to collect beads. Carefully remove and discard cleared supernatant without disturbing the bead pellet.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"4rorp","text":"Remove samples from the magnetic stand. Add 30 µl of DNA buffer and mix well by pipetting or vortexing. Ensure beads are fully resuspend and incubate samples at room temperature for 2 min.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"3q00p","text":"Incubate samples at room temperature for 5 min.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Saccharomyces cerevisiae growth, IAA treatment, 4tU labeling, and rapid fixation
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"73tco","text":"Streak appropriate S. cerevisiae strain on YPD agar. Incubate culture at 30°C for 2-3 days.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":19,"length":13}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"497cf","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6du0u","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"ddvtv","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"du3ub","text":"YPD agar and YPD are prepared and supplemented with adenine following standard procedures. Other media can be used. IAA treatment and 4tU treatment are based on Donczew et al., 2020 and Donczew and Hahn, 2021. Sampling and rapid fixation are based on Alexander et al., 2010, Barrass et al., 2015, Aslanzadeh et al., 2018, and Barrass and Beggs, 2019. Samples should be protected from light during Steps 13-21 when possible (e.g., work under red light or low light and keep samples covered with foil).","type":"unstyled"}],"collapsed":false,"entityMap":{},"guid":"3A309A46DA6B11EE822C0A58A9FEAC02"}}}}

steps.section: Schizosaccharomyces pombe growth, 4tU labeling, and rapid fixation
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"5r8fc","text":"When the 250 ml culture reaches an OD600 of 0.6, cool centrifuge to 4°C and prepare 50 ml conical tubes and 1.5 ml microcentrifuge tubes.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Saccharomyces cerevisiae growth, IAA treatment, 4tU labeling, and rapid fixation
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"7efo6","text":"When the 40 ml culture reaches an OD600 of 0.3-0.4, cool centrifuge to 4°C and prepare 50 ml conical tubes, 2.0 ml microcentrifuge tubes, and 1.5 ml microcentrifuge tubes.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Saccharomyces cerevisiae growth, IAA treatment, 4tU labeling, and rapid fixation
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"beu82","text":"Dilute overnight culture to an OD600 of 0.2 in 40 ml of YPD. Incubate culture at 30°C with shaking at 220 rpm.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Saccharomyces cerevisiae growth, IAA treatment, 4tU labeling, and rapid fixation
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"5q092","text":"Transfer an individual colony to 5 ml of YPD. Incubate culture at 30°C with shaking at 220 rpm overnight.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"ag6sm","text":"Dilute overnight culture to an OD600 of 0.2 in 250 ml of YE. Incubate culture at 30°C with shaking at 220 rpm.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Schizosaccharomyces pombe growth, 4tU labeling, and rapid fixation
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"4cl1h","text":"Add 125 ml of 100% methanol to a 1 l flask for each culture to be collected. Keep flask on dry ice. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Schizosaccharomyces pombe growth, 4tU labeling, and rapid fixation
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"detqe","text":"CRITICAL STEP: When the culture reaches an OD600 of 1.0, add 625 μl of 2 M 4tU solution. 4tU will precipitate when added to the culture; immediately and vigorously mix the culture and return it to the incubator.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":15}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Schizosaccharomyces pombe growth, 4tU labeling, and rapid fixation
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"cr7ve","text":"When the culture reaches an OD600 of 0.8, prepare a 2 M 4tU solution in DMSO as described in Step 11.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Schizosaccharomyces pombe growth, 4tU labeling, and rapid fixation
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"5es9q","text":"CRITICAL STEP:  Immediately after 4tU treatment, decant the 250 ml culture directly into 125 ml of 100% methanol in a 1 l flask on dry ice (prepared in Step 26). Gently mix the slurry by swirling to ensure homogenization. Keep the fixed sample on dry ice.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":16}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Schizosaccharomyces pombe growth, 4tU labeling, and rapid fixation
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"63kdt","text":"Incubate the culture at 30°C for 4 min.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8vu7k","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"89p65","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"fo76h","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"5qtel","text":"Cultures are generally incubated for 4 min for 4tU incorporation. The time can be adjusted based on the experiment.","type":"unstyled"}],"collapsed":false,"entityMap":{},"guid":"FD1D020FDA6C11EE822C0A58A9FEAC02"}}}}

steps.section: Schizosaccharomyces pombe growth, 4tU labeling, and rapid fixation
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"a0ij9","text":"Thoroughly resuspend the cells in each 50 ml conical tube in 540 μl of DNA/RNA Shield by pipetting and pool cell suspensions in a fresh 50 ml conical tube on ice. Samples are adjusted to the equivalent of an OD600 of 7.0.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Schizosaccharomyces pombe growth, 4tU labeling, and rapid fixation
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"blpji","text":"Carefully decant supernatant and briefly invert 50 ml conical tubes on a paper towel to remove residual supernatant.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Schizosaccharomyces pombe growth, 4tU labeling, and rapid fixation
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"27nmh","text":"Distribute 30 ml aliquots of the culture slurry to 50 ml conical tubes and centrifuge at 3,000 g and 4°C for 10 min to pellet cells.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Schizosaccharomyces pombe growth, 4tU labeling, and rapid fixation
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"1ojq6","text":"Ensure cells are thoroughly resuspended and distribute 500 μl aliquots of the cell suspension to 1.5 ml microcentrifuge tubes on ice.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"klmr","text":"OPTION B (with spike-in): Transfer 760 μl of S. cerevisiae cells suspended in DNA/RNA Shield:RNA Lysis Buffer and 40 μl of S. pombe cells suspended in DNA/RNA Shield:RNA Lysis Buffer to a ZR Bashingbead Lysis Tube.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":25},{"style":"italic","offset":45,"length":13},{"style":"italic","offset":123,"length":8}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"3rfpb","text":"OPTION B (with spike-in): Combine 360 μl of RNA Lysis Buffer and 400 μl of cells suspended in DNA/RNA Shield, and combine 500 μl of RNA Lysis Buffer and 500 μl of S. pombe cells suspended in DNA/RNA Shield.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":25},{"style":"italic","offset":163,"length":8}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2beu8","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1v44r","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"91ubj","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[{"length":8,"offset":35,"style":"italic"},{"length":25,"offset":51,"style":"italic"},{"length":13,"offset":101,"style":"italic"},{"length":8,"offset":182,"style":"italic"},{"length":13,"offset":227,"style":"italic"},{"length":8,"offset":262,"style":"italic"}],"key":"3durb","text":"See Steps 22-35 for preparation of S. pombe cells. Schizosaccharomyces pombe cells are combined with S. cerevisiae cells in mass-to-mass ratio of 1:19 based on OD600. One aliquot of S. pombe cells provides material to spike 24 S. cerevisiae samples. If multiple S. pombe samples are needed for an experiment, they should be prepared individually, pooled, and thoroughly mixed to ensure the spike-in is consistent across the experiment.","type":"unstyled"}],"collapsed":false,"entityMap":{},"guid":"7E2A4A01DA6E11EE822C0A58A9FEAC02"}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"fevuu","text":"Run fastp to extract unique molecular identifiers (UMIs) using the following commands:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4cts9","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"anss1","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"hqei","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":1,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"7f3be","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6sa6e","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"command","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"can_edit":true,"command_name":"","description":"","guid":"D8F6B9ADDA7711EE822C0A58A9FEAC02","name":"echo "processing UMIs for sample:"
for sample_name in $(cat $SAMPLES | sed "s/_R._001.fastq.gz//" | uniq)
do
	echo "  ${sample_name}..."

	(fastp \
		--in1 $DATA/${sample_name}_R1_001.fastq.gz \
		--out1 $DIRECTORY/fastp/${sample_name}_umi_R1_001.fastq.gz \
		--in2 $DATA/${sample_name}_R2_001.fastq.gz \
		--out2 $DIRECTORY/fastp/${sample_name}_umi_R2_001.fastq.gz \
		--disable_adapter_trimming \
		--disable_quality_filtering \
		--disable_length_filtering \
		--umi \
		--umi_loc read2 \
		--umi_len 12 \
		--json $DIRECTORY/logs/fastp/${sample_name}_umi_fastp.json \
		--html $DIRECTORY/logs/fastp/${sample_name}_umi_fastp.html \
		2> $DIRECTORY/logs/fastp/${sample_name}_umi_fastp.log)

done","os_name":"","os_version":""}},"1":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"97l67","text":"UMI information is stored in R1 header. UMI information is not currently used in subsequent steps. In addition to extracting UMIs, fastp produces a quality control report for raw and processed data.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{},"guid":"49E974F0407A4BE180D88E792067049E"}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"4rj6q","text":"Run bbduk from the BBMap package to trim adapter sequences and polyA tails using the following commands:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9flrg","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"e23ql","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"command","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"can_edit":true,"command_name":"","description":"","guid":"8610E882DA7811EE822C0A58A9FEAC02","name":"echo "trimming adapters for sample:"
for sample_name in $(ls -1 $DIRECTORY/fastp | sed "s/_umi_R._001.fastq.gz//" | uniq)
do
	echo "  ${sample_name}..."

	(bbduk.sh \
		in=$DIRECTORY/fastp/${sample_name}_umi_R1_001.fastq.gz \
		out=$DIRECTORY/bbduk/${sample_name}_trimmed_R1_001.fastq.gz \
		ref=$BBMAP_RESOURCES/truseq.fa.gz,$BBMAP_RESOURCES/polyA.fa.gz \
		k=13 \
		ktrim=r \
		mink=5 \
		qtrim=r \
		trimq=10 \
		minlength=20 \
		threads=16 \
		2> $DIRECTORY/logs/bbduk/${sample_name}_trimmed_bbduk.log)

done","os_name":"","os_version":""}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"8t1vq","text":"Run slamdunk all from the SLAM-DUNK package to align data and quantify total reads and reads that have ≥1 T\u003eC conversions using the following commands:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"10j3k","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"j8m9","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"cv882","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":1,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"bgh54","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"command","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"can_edit":true,"command_name":"","description":"","guid":"863BBD1FDA7911EE822C0A58A9FEAC02","name":"echo \"running slamdunk all...\"\nslamdunk all \\\n\t--reference $GENOME_scer \\\n\t--bed $BED_scer \\\n\t--outputDir $DIRECTORY/slamdunk_scer \\\n\t--trim-5p 5 \\\n\t--topn 100 \\\n\t--multimap \\\n\t--min-coverage 10 \\\n\t--var-fraction 0.8 \\\n\t--max-read-length 151 \\\n\t--min-base-qual 26 \\\n\t--skip-sam \\\n\t--threads 24 \\\n\t$DIRECTORY/bbduk/*.fastq.gz","os_name":"","os_version":""}},"1":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"8fr86","text":"See Neumann et al., 2019 and the SLAM-DUNK documentation (https://t-neumann.github.io/slamdunk/) for detailed information on the package.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{},"guid":"AA5C51F1413D437B9B3F5A1153A68B1F"}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"afemc","text":"Run slamdunk count from the SLAM-DUNK package to quantify reads that have ≥2 T\u003eC conversions using the following commands:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"cq4ks","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"bgt3m","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"command","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"can_edit":true,"command_name":"","description":"","guid":"A3570676DA7911EE822C0A58A9FEAC02","name":"echo \"running slamdunk count...\"\nslamdunk count \\\n\t--reference $GENOME_scer \\\n\t--bed $BED_scer \\\n\t--snp-directory $DIRECTORY/slamdunk_scer/snp \\\n\t--outputDir $DIRECTORY/slamdunk_scer/count_twotcreadcount \\\n\t--max-read-length 151 \\\n\t--min-base-qual 26 \\\n\t--conversion-threshold 2 \\\n\t--threads 24 \\\n\t$DIRECTORY/slamdunk_scer/filter/*.bam","os_name":"","os_version":""}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"3dqtq","text":"Run the following alleyoop commands from the SLAM-DUNK package to summarize and merge slamdunk output:  ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5v9rk","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"4mn2","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"command","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"can_edit":true,"command_name":"","description":"","guid":"CA2A0CADDA7911EE822C0A58A9FEAC02","name":"echo "running alleyoop..."
alleyoop rates \
	--outputDir $DIRECTORY/slamdunk_scer/alleyoop/rates \
	--reference $GENOME_scer \
	--min-base-qual 26 \
	--threads 24 \
	$DIRECTORY/slamdunk_scer/filter/*.bam


alleyoop tccontext \
	--outputDir $DIRECTORY/slamdunk_scer/alleyoop/tccontext \
	--reference $GENOME_scer \
	--min-base-qual 26 \
	--threads 24 \
	$DIRECTORY/slamdunk_scer/filter/*.bam


alleyoop utrrates \
	--outputDir $DIRECTORY/slamdunk_scer/alleyoop/utrrates \
	--reference $GENOME_scer \
	--bed $BED_scer \
	--multiTCStringency \
	--max-read-length 151 \
	--min-base-qual 26 \
	--threads 24 \
	$DIRECTORY/slamdunk_scer/filter/*.bam


alleyoop snpeval \
	--outputDir $DIRECTORY/slamdunk_scer/alleyoop/snpeval \
	--snp-directory $DIRECTORY/slamdunk_scer/snp \
	--reference $GENOME_scer \
	--bed $BED_scer \
	--min-coverage 10 \
	--var-fraction 0.8 \
	--multiTCStringency \
	--max-read-length 151 \
	--min-base-qual 26 \
	--threads 24 \
	$DIRECTORY/slamdunk_scer/filter/*.bam


alleyoop summary \
	--output $DIRECTORY/slamdunk_scer/alleyoop/summary_onetcreadcount.tsv \
	--tcountDir $DIRECTORY/slamdunk_scer/count_onetcreadcount \
	$DIRECTORY/slamdunk_scer/filter/*.bam


alleyoop summary \
	--output $DIRECTORY/slamdunk_scer/alleyoop/summary_twotcreadcount.tsv \
	--tcountDir $DIRECTORY/slamdunk_scer/count_twotcreadcount \
	$DIRECTORY/slamdunk_scer/filter/*.bam


alleyoop merge \
	--output $DIRECTORY/slamdunk_scer/alleyoop/merge_totalreadcount.tsv \
	--column "ReadCount" \
	$DIRECTORY/slamdunk_scer/count_onetcreadcount/*.tsv


alleyoop merge \
	--output $DIRECTORY/slamdunk_scer/alleyoop/merge_onetcreadcount.tsv \
	--column "TcReadCount" \
	$DIRECTORY/slamdunk_scer/count_onetcreadcount/*.tsv


alleyoop merge \
	--output $DIRECTORY/slamdunk_scer/alleyoop/merge_twotcreadcount.tsv \
	--column "TcReadCount" \
	$DIRECTORY/slamdunk_scer/count_twotcreadcount/*.tsv


alleyoop tcperreadpos \
	--outputDir $DIRECTORY/slamdunk_scer/alleyoop/tcperreadpos \
	--reference $GENOME_scer \
	--snp-directory $DIRECTORY/slamdunk_scer/snp \
	--max-read-length 151 \
	--min-base-qual 26 \
	--threads 24 \
	$DIRECTORY/slamdunk_scer/filter/*.bam


alleyoop tcperutrpos \
	--outputDir $DIRECTORY/slamdunk_scer/alleyoop/tcperutrpos \
	--reference $GENOME_scer \
	--bed $BED_scer \
	--snp-directory $DIRECTORY/slamdunk_scer/snp \
	--max-read-length 151 \
	--min-base-qual 26 \
	--threads 24 \
	$DIRECTORY/slamdunk_scer/filter/*.bam


alleyoop dump \
	--outputDir $DIRECTORY/slamdunk_scer/alleyoop/dump \
	--reference $GENOME_scer \
	--snp-directory $DIRECTORY/slamdunk_scer/snp \
	--min-base-qual 26 \
	--threads 24 \
	$DIRECTORY/slamdunk_scer/filter/*.bam","os_name":"","os_version":""}}}}

All ORFs were extended 250 bp beyond their stop position using SAMtools (version 1.14) and BEDTools (version 2.30.0) to include 3′ UTRs. Chromosome names in the BED file were modified to reflect standard nomenclature (https://www.yeastgenome.org/). Reference files (i.e., genome assembly and BED file) must be checked to ensure the same chromosome names are used. steps.section: Schizosaccharomyces pombe growth, 4tU labeling, and rapid fixation
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"115fi","text":"PAUSE POINT: Flash freeze the samples on dry ice or in liquid nitrogen and store at -80°C until proceeding.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":12}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"7sgvo","text":"Combine cells suspended in DNA/RNA Shield with RNA Lysis Buffer using one of the following options:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"d67m1","text":"Transfer cells suspended in DNA/RNA Shield:RNA Lysis Buffer to a ZR Bashingbead Lysis Tube using one of the following options:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"8pf2j","text":"OPTION A (without spike-in): Transfer 800 μl of cells suspended in 1:1 DNA/RNA Shield:RNA Lysis Buffer to a ZR Bashingbead Lysis Tube.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":28}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"bv2a7","text":"During RNA fragmentation, bring the RT reaction mixture (prepared in Step 72.4) to room temperature for 2-5 minutes. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"2ed3l","text":"Briefly centrifuge and return samples to a thermocycler at 42°C. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"dviai","text":"Equilibrate speedbeads to room temperature and mix thoroughly.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"bj2jk","text":"Mix well by pipetting up and down a minimum of 10 times. Alternatively, vortex samples on setting 4 for 3-5 seconds. If samples require centrifugation after mixing, stop the centrifuge before beads settle.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"979uq","text":"CRITICAL STEP: Carefully add the indicated amount of speedbeads to the sample.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":15}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"flsuu","text":"Repeat Step 82 once. Carefully inspect samples and remove remaining ethanol using a 10 μl pipet.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"8oobm","text":"Add 200 μl of 80% ethanol (freshly prepared with MilliQ water) and incubate for 30 s. Carefully remove ethanol and discard without disturbing the bead pellet.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"lj61","text":"Carefully remove and discard cleared supernatant without disturbing the bead pellet.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"b4c3m","text":"Place samples on magnetic stand for 2-5 min (or until solution is completely clear) to collect beads. Keep samples on magnetic stand for Steps 81-85. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"ati0q","text":"Incubate samples at room temperature for 5 min. Prolonged incubation or incubation at low temperature will increase binding of small nucleic acids (e.g., adapter dimers).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"42toj","text":"CRITICAL STEP: Air dry samples for 2 min with lid open. Do not over-dry samples. Speedbeads (and other SPRI products) will clump and can not be fully resuspended during elution if samples are over-dried.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":15}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"a4c5r","text":"Transfer cleared supernatant (volume of solution added for elution less 1 μl) to a fresh PCR tube.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"9n14n","text":"Remove samples from the magnetic stand. Add the indicated volume of appropriate solution for elution and mix well by pipetting or vortexing (see Step 78).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"eo07b","text":"Place samples on a magnetic stand for 2 min (or until solution is completely clear) to collect beads.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"cl167","text":"Incubate mixture at room temperature for 2-5 min.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"9gs64","text":"Library quality control, quantification, pooling, and sequencing.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":65}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"dn8l5","text":"Quantify libraries using a DNA-specific fluorometry method (i.e., Qubit dsDNA BR or HS assay kit).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"8t354","text":"Assess library quality using an Agilent Bioanalyzer or agarose gel electrophoresis. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"4sslv","text":"Download reference genome and annotation files. The reference genome assembly and annotation for S. cerevisiae strain S288C (version R64-3-1, RefSeq Assembly GCF_000146045.2) can be retrieved from the NCBI Datasets repository.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":97,"length":13}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"clq1s","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ejgcv","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"6s2p4","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"f2r4m","text":"Chromosome names should be modified in the reference genome assembly to reflect standard nomenclature (https://www.yeastgenome.org/) and maintain compatibility with BED file described below.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{},"guid":"512D80A283E540E4A90AC394AF01E963"}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"68p7q","text":"Pool equimolar concentrations (i.e., 5 nM) of each library. The recommended final concentration of the pool is 5 nM.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"f44ka","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ilii","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"8oqk6","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"ccnjq","text":"See Glenn et al., 2019 for additional information on pooling and a template for calculating molar concentrations and volumes. Methods for library construction that use a template switching oligo (TSO), as described here, generate forward reads that start with three low-diversity bases. It is necessary to increase the diversity of the sequencing pool prior to sequencing on an Illumina instrument. Libraries should be pooled with 10-15% libraries prepared using standard approaches or control libraries (see Veeranagouda et al., 2019 for additional details).","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{},"guid":"89FB41577EA44EFBAA7791EAE0AB1229"}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"f81g7","text":"Run multiqc to compile output from the SLAM-DUNK package using the following commands: ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"mgvu","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"a6acr","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"792bf","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":1,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"5v3ks","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"command","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"can_edit":true,"command_name":"","description":"","guid":"093800FFDB3511EEBBD10A58A9FEAC02","name":"echo \"running multiqc on slamdunk output...\"\nmultiqc\\\n\t$DIRECTORY/slamdunk_scer/alleyoop \\\n\t--outdir $DIRECTORY/logs/multiqc/slamdunk_scer \\\n\t--quiet \\\n\t\u0026\u003e /dev/null","os_name":"","os_version":""}},"1":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"35s83","text":"See the SLAM-DUNK documentation (https://t-neumann.github.io/slamdunk/) for an example MultiQC report and additional information. ","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{},"guid":"9DBB2C35353F415CAC86302CE2F0B849"}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"12ppn","text":"Sequence the library pool on an Illumina instrument (e.g., NovaSeq 6000). The recommended sequencing depth is 10 million reads per sample.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"7efsb","text":"Run fastqc to assess raw data quality and multiqc to compile the fastqc output using following the commands: ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"934if","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"ai7f1","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9oslh","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":1,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"es6i1","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"command","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"can_edit":true,"command_name":"","description":"","guid":"64C8FA88DB3411EEBBD10A58A9FEAC02","name":"echo "running fastqc on raw data for sample:"
for sample_name in $(cat $SAMPLES | sed "s/_001.fastq.gz//" | uniq)
do
	echo "  ${sample_name}..."

	(fastqc \
		$DATA/${sample_name}_001.fastq.gz \
		--outdir $DIRECTORY/logs/fastqc/fastq \
		--threads 64 \
		--quiet \
		&> /dev/null)

done


echo "running multiqc on raw data..."
multiqc	\
	$DIRECTORY/logs/fastqc/fastq \
	--outdir $DIRECTORY/logs/multiqc/fastq \
	--quiet \
	&> /dev/null","os_name":"","os_version":""}},"1":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"ertvj","text":"Here and in subsequent steps, the number of requested threads can be changed based on system capacity. ","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{},"guid":"B0A9C2472BCF45A1A0D6C689ADAB1071"}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"c6oig","text":"OPTIONAL STEP: If experiments used S. pombe spike-in cells, set variables and make subdirectories using the commands below. Download the reference S. pombe genome assembly. Download the reference S. pombe BED file attached below. Repeat Steps 98-103 to generate spike-in count tables.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":15},{"style":"italic","offset":35,"length":8},{"style":"italic","offset":147,"length":8},{"style":"italic","offset":196,"length":9}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"al5e6","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"9q1br","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"c68cm","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":1,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"4cp5r","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"command","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"can_edit":true,"command_name":"","description":"","guid":"69DF2E4EDBD311EEAC5E0A58A9FEAC02","name":"GENOME_spom="reference_S.pombe_genome_file"
BED_spom="reference_S.pombe_bed_file"

mkdir -p $DIRECTORY/slamdunk_spom
mkdir -p $DIRECTORY/slamdunk_spom/count_conversionthreshold
mkdir -p $DIRECTORY/slamdunk_spom/alleyoop
mkdir -p $DIRECTORY/logs/multiqc/slamdunk_spom","os_name":"","os_version":""}},"1":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[{"length":8,"offset":49,"style":"italic"},{"length":9,"offset":189,"style":"italic"}],"key":"7hqog","text":"The reference genome assembly and annotation for S. pombe strain 972h- (version ASM294v2, RefSeq Assembly GCF_000002945.1) can be retrieved from the NCBI Datasets repository. {"blocks":[{"key":"d5vs7","text":"Run fastqc to assess preprocessed data quality and multiqc to compile the fastqc output using following the commands: ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"pp4t","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"4mtn6","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"command","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"can_edit":true,"command_name":"","description":"","guid":"B158DBBADBD511EEAC5E0A58A9FEAC02","name":"echo "running fastqc on preprocessed data..."
